newsitem.title: CHINA: Joint ventures in Guangdong record more business.
newsitem.headline: Joint ventures in Guangdong record more business.

text.p: Imports and exports of Sino-foreign joint ventures in the booming southern Chinese province of Guangdong rose to $26.4 billion in the first six months of 1996, up 12.4 percent from the corresponding period last year, Xinhua news agency said on Friday.
The figure accounted for 52.9 percent of Guangdong's total imports and exports, the agency said.
Imports by Sino-foreign joint ventures in the province climbed 28.5 percent to $470 million between January and June after import tariffs were reduced in April, Xinhua said.
